title: Tiptree Walks

images.title: Roger Jones / West End Road, Tiptree Heath
images.caption: West End Road, Tiptree Heath

images.title: Glyn Baker / Tiptree Heath
images.caption: This is Tiptree Heath is an SSSI and registered common when the photo was taken it was managed by Tiptree Parish Council. Now management has passed to Essex Wildlife Trust and the Friends of Tiptree Heath. It is an important wildlife area for both plants and animals. The 25-hectare heath is the largest surviving fragment of heathland in Essex and is a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Noteable flora found on the heath include Cross-leaved Heather (Erica tetralix), Bell Heather (Erica cinerea) and Ling or Common Heather (Calluna). To help maintain the heath, Dexter cattle are grazed there during the summer and a herd of 8 hardy Exmoor ponies throughout the year.

images.title: Robert Edwards, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Messing Maypole Mill, a Grade II* listed tower mill, and the preserves company Wilkin & Sons, whose products use the village name as part of their brand, are located in the village.

images.title: Andrew Hill / Beech tree roots at The Ramparts
images.caption: Beech tree roots at The Ramparts. These are enough to make one believe in hobbit traps. The ancient ditch is a scheduled monument worth visiting for its secretive atmosphere. Apart from legendary associations with Boudica's defeat by the Romans, I have not discovered much factual detail about the site on the internet.

images.title: Andrew Hill / Track to The Rampart east of Pods Wood
images.caption: Track to The Rampart east of Pods Wood

images.title: Andrew Hill / In Pods Wood
images.caption: In Pods Wood. There are more conifers towards the eastern side of the wood, here seen growing from a woodland floor dominated by bracken.

images.title: Andrew Hill / War memorial and police station, Tiptree
images.caption: War memorial and police station. On the corner of Church Road (B1023) and Chapel Road.

images.title: Andrew Hill / Small park at Grove Lake, Tiptree
images.caption: Small park at Grove Lake, Tiptree

description: This large village is located near Colchester in Essex. This walk explores the Tiptree Heath Nature Reserve before heading to the woodland and countryside to the east of the settlement. The walk starts from the car park at Tiptree Heath. There's some nice footpaths across the heath with interesting flora and fauna to look out for on the way. After exploring the heath you head north east to Tiptree Quarry before passing through the town. The route then heads to the Rampart, a scheduled ancient monument with some unusual gnarled trees. Around here you can also pick up some woodland trails through the adjacent Pods Wood. The village includes a small park at Grove Road Lake, just to the north of the centre, off Church Road. It's a pretty place for a short stroll in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Ship Inn is a good choice for some post walk refreshment. They serve good quality food which you can enjoy in the lovely conservatory area or the pretty garden. You can find them at 152 Maldon Rd, TCO5 0PQ.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The heath is a lovely place for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners on your visit. The woods at the eastern end of the route are also ideal for dog walking. The Ship mentioned above is dog friendly too.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the east you'll find the expansive Abberton Reservoir. The reservoir is excellent for bird watching with thousands of wildlfowl to look out for on the water. Near here you'll also find Mersea Island. The round the island circular walk visits a number of nice beaches and the pretty Cudmore Grove Country Park. On the northern side of Colchester there's High Woods Country Park. There's some pleasant cycling and walking trails with a lake, woodland trails and a visitor centre as well. For more walking ideas in the area see the Essex Walks page.

display_address: Simpsons Lane, Maldon Road, Tiptree, Colchester, Essex, England, CO5 0PQ, United Kingdom
